file_content.text: The Esh-kha won't be troubling anyone ever again.
There you are. We were getting worried. Thought maybe I'd sent you to your death down there.
There you are. We were getting worried. Thought maybe I'd sent you all to your deaths down there.
General Skylast told me about the World Razer. Hard to believe something like that's been down in the vaults this whole time.
So, what happened? Did you stop the World Razer?
The mission was a failure, General. The Esh-kha already freed the World Razer. It will take a long time before it is mobile, though.
I was too late.
Hmm. Now that'll complicate things.
I'd rather not say.
That bad, huh?
I'll tell the Jedi Council to expect the worst. Maybe something can be done to buy us time.
At least we've got advance warning. We'll be ready. You've done the Republic a great service here.
The World Razer's been sealed. He won't be going anywhere for a long time.
Locked away for good.
I handled it. Barely.
Knew I could count on you. Fine work out there.
The World Razer's not our concern anymore.
It's out of our hands.
Was hoping for a more thorough debrief, but if you say it's over, I'll take your word for it.
I can't thank you enough for all your contributions. You've done the Republic a real service.
Project Noble Focus would still be up and running if you hadn't exposed Senator Tudos and stopped those Rattataki.
We've made huge strides in restoring order to the minimum security wing. Those Condemned inmates shouldn't trouble us anymore.
And you even took out Gore Claw. Good riddance, I say. That lunatic had it coming.
I guess that puts an end to the Esh-kha's plans once and for all.
It's finally over.
Hate to be an optimist, but it looks like it.
Not quite.
Glad I could help.
That wrap things up?
The Esh-kha are still on the lam, but they've taken a big hit today.
Still plenty of stragglers, but with Gore Claw dead, a lot of them have started killing each other. Weird, but I can't complain.
You put a lot on the line to help us out there. The Republic owes you one.
Unfortunately, Gore Claw's death has mobilized the Esh-kha. They're desperate now, and it's only made them more dangerous.
They're making their final push off this rock. They've plowed through our defenses--they're just a massacre away from clinching their freedom.
If this World Razer actually exists, waking it up is probably the worst thing the Esh-kha could do. You've got to stop them.
Best place to start is the Deep Prison--all kinds of ancient monstrosities sealed away down there. You'll be on your own, though. Watch yourself.
The Esh-kha won't set foot off this planet.
The Esh-kha general is dead.
Good. Losing their leader will demoralize the Esh-kha; they'll be disoriented and disorganized.
Pretty soon, we'll be able to scatter their forces and drive them back to the vaults.
Looks like you don't need me anymore.
Then I leave this to you.
Wouldn't have lasted without you.
Have fun with that.
It'll still be a slow, tedious process, but we'll get it done.
Can I finally leave?
I think it's safe to say the Esh-kha threat has finally been neutralized. Good work.
The Esh-kha general is dead, but he mentioned something about awakening a "World Razer" that would destroy us all.
Wait--the World Razer? He said that?
So maybe it is true. This is bad.
The Esh-kha seemed to think this World Razer was going to destroy the planet.
To say the least.
Yeah, sounds like what you'd expect from a "World Razer."
Have you heard about the World Razer before?
What's true?
Just rumors. Not from the most reliable sources, mind you.
I'm sure he just said that to mess with our heads.
Don't be gullible.
I'm not so sure. I've heard of this World Razer before.
A few deep-cell inmates were babbling about it. Could barely understand a word they said, much less put any stock in it.
Went on about this... thing in the planet's core. Claimed it was massive, as old as the galaxy. I thought it was just superstitious nonsense.
The Esh-kha believe in it. That's enough for me.
Clearly it has merit.
The galaxy is a strange place. Even the most horrible tales can wind up being true.
Don't discount anything.
No sense in taking risks when the Republic's safety is at stake. We need to look into this.
We can't take that chance.
It's a big galaxy. Anything's possible.
Should've known better.
Certainly seen my share of crazy stuff down here.
You didn't even bother looking into it?
So you ignored it?
We were too busy fighting prisoners, Imperials and genocidal monsters to confirm a few spook stories.
A few prisoners and a dying Esh-kha aren't the most reliable sources.
I'm still skeptical.
The prisoners' terror looked real enough. And the Esh-kha may be a lot of things, but they're not liars.
It's time we ended this.
You've probably guessed the Republic didn't build this place. Was constructed thousands of years ago by a species called the Rakata.
The Rakata hated the Esh-kha--wrote about them like they were a plague. Waged a war that engulfed the entire galaxy.
In the end, the Esh-kha were nearly wiped out; the few hundred thousand survivors brought here to be locked away in stasis.
If only the Imperials had known how dangerous the Esh-kha were.
Until the Empire came along.
Idiots were so giddy about making life difficult for us that they didn't notice all the "Do not open" signs.
How have I not heard about any of this?
This is news to me.
SIS has been keeping a lid on this whole affair. "Need-to-know" and all that.
The Rakata didn't use any discretion when they punished the Esh-kha. Just lumped them all together.
Their imprisonment was unjust.
Smart move on their part.
The Rakata could have saved us all a lot of heartache by just killing the Esh-kha.
Should've wiped them out.
The Esh-kha still had their uses. Apparently, the Rakata would pull them out of stasis and unleash them on unruly planets.
The Esh-kha conquered half the galaxy in their heyday, and they'll pick up right where they left off if they ever escape.
Your raid caught them off guard. They're crippled, shaken. Now's the time to press our advantage and halt their advance for good.
The less time we give them to recover, the better.
Then let's do it.
What do you have in mind?
Naturally.
I think that pretty much goes without saying.
No kidding.
We've traced the bulk of the Esh-kha's comm activity back to a small cavern. We think they're using it as a command station.
Whoever's in there is coordinating the Esh-kha's entire offensive. It's our best shot at taking out their leadership. I want you to take it.
You're putting a lot of trust in me. I won't let you down.
I'm honored.
If it will put an end to this madness.
I accept.
I haven't let you down yet. Hadn't planned on starting.
I won't fail.
I do best when the stakes are high.
Good choice.
Let's just get it done.
There's a lot of extra comm chatter coming out of that station. Not sure what all the commotion is about, but we can't wait to find out.
Find the station, take out the leadership, then maybe we can go back to pushing the Imperials off this rock.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
We may not get another opportunity like this.
You did it--and then some. With their leaders dead and their supplies destroyed, the Esh-kha are in a bad way.
They're pulling back now. Should give us time to catch our breath. Thanks.
They're vulnerable. Now's the time to keep the pressure on them.
Don't let up.
I'm sending a few squads out to retake some of our more defensible outposts. Not much, but it's a start.
What else can you tell me about these Esh-kha?
Where do they come from?
Piece of cake.
Wasn't just a fluke, I can see that.
You were true to your word--the Esh-kha leaders are down and their grunts are scrambling to reorganize.
You did it. Once the Esh-kha realized their supplies were being wiped out, they turned tail, just like we hoped.
Hit those Esh-kha with everything you've got.
Agh... chest... hurts....
Try not to breathe, son. Rib's broken, almost punctured your lung. Gonna try and move it....
General Skylast! We've lost the bridge! Enemy's smashed through, heading right for us.
Knew we couldn't hold them long. Tell everyone to fall back. We'll make our stand here.
We finally meet. The Esh-kha are making their final push off this rock... just a massacre away from clinching their freedom.
Their onslaught stops here.
That won't happen.
It better. We've got nowhere else to run.
The Esh-kha will bring only mayhem and death to the galaxy. They mustn't escape.
That would be catastrophic.
Don't know that we'll have much say in the matter.
I've seen how these Esh-kha operate. I beat them once, I'll do it again.
I know how to win.
And here I just finished scraping those last few Esh-kha off my boot.
Here we go again.
Was quite a licking you gave them last time. Hope you've got another in you.
Is the Republic sending any more troops our way?
Any reinforcements coming?
Hard to recruit soldiers for a war nobody knows about. Took every bit of clout I had just to get this many here.
So?
You fought them before. We need your experience.
The Esh-kha have already overrun all our defensive outposts. This is our last shot at stopping them.
Welcome to the fight for Belsavis, Master Jedi. You're just in time to be torn apart by a horde of escaped warmongers.
Welcome to the new front line, Major. Better check your gear. Got a battalion of crazed warmongers on their way here now.
Welcome to the front lines, Captain. Hope you're looking for a fight. Pretty soon, we'll be up to our elbows in kill-crazy warmongers.
Might want to think about turning back. Got an army of escaped warmongers on the way.
The Force brought me here for a reason. Perhaps I can stem this tide.
Maybe I should help.
Hope so. Running low on ammo--and men.
I suppose negotiating with them is out of the question.
No diplomacy, then?
Yeah, not gonna happen.
Havoc Squad's faced down superior forces before, sir. I'm with you until the end.
I'm not afraid.
Glad to hear it, soldier. Could use the extra blaster.
I'm not going anywhere; not while your men still have credits to their name. Pazaak, anyone?
Live a little, while you can.
Maybe when we're done here.
You'll need to be more specific. What are we dealing with here?
Who's coming?
You coward.
Fear keeps a soldier from running willy-nilly into blaster fire. It saves lives.
Imperials got careless, opened something they shouldn't have. Unleashed an entire army on us--some species we've never seen.
They're called "Esh-kha." Remnants of a galaxy-spanning civilization predating the Republic. Couldn't play nice and got sentenced here. Permanently.
Not all Esh-kha are violent; some tried to facilitate a peaceful coexistence with other species.
They aren't all bad.
If you say so. Have yet to meet one who wasn't trying to take my head off.
Things were bad enough when we only had riots to deal with. Now we've got a whole army on the loose?
It just keeps getting worse.
At least they're not taking sides. Imperials have been getting hit as hard as we have.
If the Republic didn't lock them up, then who did?
How'd they get here?
A species even older than the Esh-kha. Had the right notion, keeping them here--too bad it didn't take.
Didn't seem to do much for their temperament. They still don't play nice.
They haven't changed.
You'd think a few thousand years in stasis would've cooled them off a bit. No such luck.
These Esh-kha are relentless. Been hammering us nonstop. Won't be long before they overrun us.
We need a diversion--something to put them on the defensive and stall their momentum. That's where you come in.
Take the fight to them? Risky, but it just might work.
It's worth a try.
The Esh-kha's victories will have made them overconfident. We may yet catch them by surprise.
They won't be expecting it.
It's a long shot, but it's all we've got.
Just give me a chance to get behind their lines. You'll get your diversion.
Count me in.
It's also where my compensation comes in.
Let's talk payment first.
You do your part, you'll get your credits.
A diversion will slow them down, but it won't stop them.
That'll only delay them.
This diversion could be the game-changing act we need to turn the tide of this battle.
Uh-oh.
What I'm proposing is dangerous, but it beats waiting for the Esh-kha to wipe us out.
We've pinpointed two potential targets: a supply depot and an outpost housing some of the Esh-kha's key leaders.
Hitting either of those ought to draw their warriors back and allow us to retake some ground.
The Esh-kha will be nothing without a chain of command.
The leaders.
They're holed up in an outpost right now, probably planning something horrible for us. Kill every last one of them.
You're still welcome to go after the supply depot. Dangerous, but every bit helps.
Taking out that depot ought to slow down the Esh-kha.
The supply depot.
The depot is packed with munitions and medical supplies. Destroy it all.
You're also welcome to take a crack at those lieutenants. Risky, but every bit helps.
I'll see if I can get some more answers about these Esh-kha while you're out. Good hunting.
We've got incoming hostiles. Lots.
Not my priority, but...
